Wi-Fi Repeater using ESP32

Extending Wi‑Fi coverage with an ESP32 based embedded system featuring automatic signal detection, amplification and seamless network bridging.

ESP32 Embedded Networking IoT

Overview

This project implements a cost‑effective Wi‑Fi repeater using the ESP32 microcontroller. It captures and re‑broadcasts signals to eliminate dead zones, providing a seamless extended network. Configuration is handled through an onboard web interface with real‑time diagnostics.

Optimizations include adaptive channel selection, power management, and antenna tuning, resulting in significant coverage improvement while maintaining stability and throughput.

300%
Coverage Gain
95%
Reliability

Key Features

  • Automatic signal strength evaluation & amplification
  • Transparent network bridging with minimal latency
  • Web‑based configuration dashboard (channel & power settings)
  • Real‑time RSSI monitoring & diagnostics

Technical Stack

Hardware

  • ESP32 WROOM module (dual‑core Wi‑Fi/BT)
  • External 5dBi antenna (SMA)
  • DC‑DC Buck supply (power optimization)
  • OLED status display (optional)

Firmware / Software

  • ESP-IDF / Arduino framework
  • Custom Wi‑Fi scan & channel arbitration logic
  • Async web server (configuration UI)
  • EEPROM persistence for settings
